title: Queen Elizabeth's dresser spills royal secrets in new memoir
text:
CLOSE Queen Elizabeth has a huge staff to wait on her hand and foot at Buckingham Palace, quite literally. Buzz60

Queen Elizabeth's longtime dresser-turned-personal-assistant is spilling some royal secrets.

In a memoir titled "The Other Side of the Coin: The Queen, the Dresser and the Wardrobe," Angela Kelly, who has worked with the monarch for 25 years, shared details about the royal's style and more.

According to exclusive excerpts in U.K.'s Hello! magazine, Kelly says the queen does not break in shoes herself – instead, Kelly breaks them in for her.

"The Queen has very little time to herself and not time to wear in her own shoes, and as we share the same shoe size it makes the most sense this way," she writes.

Kelly also talks about the protocol-breaking hug between the queen and Michelle Obama in 2009.

More: It's Queen Elizabeth vs. Princess Margaret in juicy 'The Crown' Season 3 trailer

Queen Elizabeth II sits with Anna Wintour, Caroline Rush (L), chief executive of the British Fashion Council (BFC) and royal dressmaker Angela Kelly (R) on Feb. 20, 2018 in London. (Photo: WPA Pool, Getty Images)

"The Queen has the ability to make everyone feel so relaxed that sometimes it feels instinctive to be tactile with her, just as Michelle Obama demonstrated during the State Visit with her husband, President Obama, in 2009," she writes. "In reality it was a natural instinct for the Queen to show affection and respect for another great woman."

Kelly also says the queen was all for speaking at the 2012 Olympics opening ceremony in London when approached with the idea.

"Without hesitation, Her Majesty replied: 'Of course...' " Kelly writes. "I asked whether she would like to say: 'Good evening, James,' or 'Good evening, Mr. Bond,' and she chose the latter, knowing the Bond films."

Kelly's memoir is being sold at the official royal gift shop, listed online for 20 pounds (about $25.75).
